body:
If your code is not arranged in a format that the go tool expects, then it
probably won't work, as you have found. It might work, as you've also
found, but you are using the tool outside the constraints that it defines,
so its operation is undefined and purely coincidental.

My recommendation to you is to not fight the go tool, you won't win and
you'll end up frustrated and loose the opportunity to use Go.

On Fri, 5 Feb 2016, 20:14 arogarth <notifications@github.com> wrote:

> Hi,
>
> my source file is not inside defined GOPATH, yes. If I set GOPATH to
> project directory (/home/user/project) it will also fail.
>
> But if I point GOPATH outside my project, like /tmp/go, all works fine.
>
> Maybe the tool go get have to ignore resolving dependencies inside $GOPATH
